items.title: Keep teeth shining throughout 2026 and beyond with Oral-B’s iO Deep Clean Series 3 electric toothbrush at $60
items.summary:
Oral-B iO Deep Clean Series 3 Limited Electric Toothbrush w/ 2 Brush Heads + Travel Case

Buy for $60 (Reg. $110)

What we love

With a New Year comes a new you, and what better way to emphasize such than with a smarter means to maintain your pearly whites? By upgrading to this iO Deep Clean Series 3 e-toothbrush, you’ll be gaining three different cleaning modes, pressure sensors that alert you when not applying enough pressure (or too much), as well as a 2-minute timer so you’re doing the proper recommended amount of cleaning. What’s more, you’re getting two starter brush heads – with the device alerting you when they need replacing – as well as a travel case.

Barry Schwartz / Search Engine Roundtable:
Tailwind CSS lays off three of its four engineers after Google traffic to its documentation fell ~40% from early 2023 due to AI, causing an ~80% drop in revenue  —  Adam Wathan the creator of Tailwind CSS posted that he had to let go of 75% of his engineering team because of AI.

items.title: iGarden expands ‘artful living’ motto at CES 2026 with new flagship robot pool cleaner, lawn mower, and aquatic fitness trainer
items.summary:
CES 2026 is in full swing, and we’ve already seen a stunning array of new innovations across a multitude of technologies. Among the many companies revealing their latest upgrades, iGarden, a brand that prides itself on “artful living technology,” has unveiled quite a lineup of new additions, including a trust-centered AI ecosystem, as well as three new flagship products – a pool cleaning robot, an aquatic fitness trainer, and even a new series of robot lawn mowers. Outdoor living has been becoming the latest frontier for smart home integrations in recent years, and iGarden is aiming to position itself at the forefront of this frontier with these next-gen robotics.

items.title: Tenways’ CGO800S urban commuter and AGO X all-terrain e-bikes see up to $907 flash savings to lows from $1,699
items.summary:
Tenways has a New Year flash sale running that is taking up to $600 off two e-bikes while offering up to $307 in FREE gear, too. For a short time longer, you can jump on Tenways’ CGO800S Premium Step-Thru Commuter e-bike with a FREE $227 bundle of gear at $1,699 shipped, or the AGO X All-Terrain Mid-Drive e-bike with a FREE $307 bundle of gear at $1,899 shipped. These models (with their bundles) would normally run you $2,226 and $2,806 without any savings, with the CGO800S returning to the lowest price we have tracked since 2024 ended, while the AGO X is dropping down to its all-time low that was last seen during early Black Friday sales in 2025. Both bundles provide you with compatible mudguards, a kickstand, and a rear carrier for their respective e-bikes, making these some of the best deals we’ve seen across the last year and further back.
